sense.gloss: pollution, contamination, corruption, graft
muddiness, murkiness, cloudiness, unclearness
impurity (of the world, one's heart, etc.)
dakuten (diacritic indicating a voiced consonant)
unrefined sake
to make muddy (of a liquid), to make cloudy, to make turbid, to roil
to make ambiguous, to evade (e.g. the point), to be noncommittal about
cloudiness, turbidity, nebula (medical)
becoming turbid, becoming muddy, becoming cloudy, becoming opaque
becoming muddled (of thoughts, senses, etc.), growing dim (of consciousness)
disorder, chaos
good and evil, purity and impurity
voiced and unvoiced consonants
voiced consonant marks
to become muddy, to become cloudy, to become turbid, to become impure (of a liquid or gas)
to become dull (of a sound, color, etc.), to become indistinct, to become fuzzy, to become hoarse
to become impure (of one's heart, a society, etc.), to be corrupted, to be polluted
to become voiced (of a consonant), to be pronounced as a voiced sound
syllable with a voiced consonant (in Japanese), voiced sound
dakuten, diacritic used with kana that turns an unvoiced consonant into a voiced consonant

sdata.j: ↑水面↑↓すいめん↓から↑飛↑↓と↓び↑立↑↓た↓つ↑鳥↑↓とり↓は↑努↑↓つと↓めてあとを↑濁↑↓にご↓さぬようにする。
sdata.e: A bird flying out of the water is careful not to cause turbulence.

sdata.j: ↑川↑↓かわ↓は↑泥↑↓どろ↓で↑濁↑↓にご↓っていた。
sdata.e: The river was cloudy with silt.

sdata.j: ↑尿↑↓にょう↓の↑色↑↓いろ↓が↑濁↑↓にご↓っています。
↑湖↑↓みずうみ↓の↑水↑↓みず↓は↑濁↑↓にご↓っている。
sdata.e: The water in the lake is murky.

words.gloss: to make muddy (of a liquid), to make cloudy, to make turbid, to roil
